metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10926 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_mknod_req supported by glusterfs server. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to write files to an arbitrary location via path traversal and execute arbitrary code on a glusterfs server node. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled RPC requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to write iles to an arbitrary location and execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-cli - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterd0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
